column1: Karabash (Russian: Карабаш) is a town in Chelyabinsk Oblast
column3: located 90 kilometers (56 mi) northwest of Chelyabinsk. Population: 13

column1: It was founded in 1822 as a settlement of gold-miners. Town status was granted to it on June 20
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as the Town of Karabash—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Karabash is incorporated as Karabashsky Urban Okrug.

column1: A copper smelting plant is situated in the town
column2: and its toxic waste has created extremely large amounts of pollution and serious health problems for the inhabitants.
